inn1.comm: full toss outside off, looks like the ball slipped out of his hand, de Silva easily drops it into the off side and gets off the mark
yorker outside off, Perera jams his bat down and squeezes it out off the inside part of the bat to fine leg
fuller ball outside off, presses forward and gets an outside edge to third man
good length ball just outside off, punched solidly from the crease to mid-off

another yorker on leg and middle, looks like the ball has it some part of Perera's leg. The ball goes to fine leg and Perera limps across for the single. Hit him bang on top of the foot off the inside edge, actually, and Perera is being attended to
sprays it full and down the leg side, de Silva makes no contact on the attempted glance and it is called a wide
full and outside off, punched solidly off the front foot to mid-off
starts off with a fuller ball on the fourth stump channel, Perera gets forward and pushes it wide of mid-off for a single
full ball, width on offer outside off, de Silva leans forward and crunches a drive between cover and point
angling in on leg from the good length area, tucked off the hips behind square. Fine leg is a bit slow in coming around and gathering it, so they take the extra run
fuller ball, shaping away late, de Silva takes a stride across and lets it go
full ball on off and middle, clipped to midwicket
good length ball on the fourth or fifth stump channel, blocked into the covers off the front foot
straying down leg, tries to tuck it off the pads, but gets it off them instead behind square
fuller ball outside off, pushes at it without feet and gets it off the splice to third man

superbly driven. It was full and outside off, holding its line as well and Kusal Perera crunches a drive through extra cover. Does not move his feet as much but times it to perfection and uses the pace on that delivery well

poor shot. Perera goes for a flick across the line and loses his stumps. It was full and pushed across. Perera looked to flick it but the away angle was always going to make that a risky shot. It shapes across late as well and Perera makes no contact with the ball which crashes into and splinters his off-stump
fuller ball on the fifth-stump channel, Dickwella reaches out for it outside off and drills it to mid-off

fuller ball and enough width on offer outside off, Dickwella takes a stride forward and just eases into the drive. It's just a push, actually, didn't try to hit it too hard at all. Makes use of the pace on the delivery and just caresses it between extra cover and long-off
short of good length on the stumps, shuffles across and blocks down the pitch
this one's even shorter and de Silva hops back to ride the bounce before keeping it out down the pitch
fuller ball, moving away from de Silva who stretches forward and pushes it to mid-off
tucked behind square

fuller ball outside off, leans forward and creams it through extra cover, not enough on that shot for the ball to carry all the way to the boundary, but they have enough time to come back for the second by the time the ball is pulled back
fuller ball on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
fuller ball outside off, comes forward and punches it to covers
pitched up on the fourth stump channel, de Silva leans into the drive which goes to covers

short and wide outside off, enough room and bounces just enough for de Silva to open up his arms and slap it through cover-point. The point fielder gives it a chase but the ball beats him to the boundary
that's more like it. It was on a length and Brathwaite gets it to just shape away a little bit as de Silva is beaten as he sticks his bat out on the front foot
short and wide, swinging away late, de Silva swings wildly but gets beaten by the late movement
stays in the crease and blocks it into the off side

short of a length ball, gets it to bounce a little bit more than Dickwella anticipated as he flicks it uppishly off the splice to short leg. Shouts of catch it but the ball drops short of the fielder there
wide delivery, angling away outside off, Dickwella stabs it to backward point
fuller outside off, drills it with soft hands back down the pitch, just to the right of the bowler
fuller ball outside off, leans forward and uses the pace on the delivery to ease it past mid-off, the fielder there gives it a chase and pulls it back
angling in on the pads from the good length region, looks to tuck it away to the leg side but wears it on the pads as the ball goes to the leg side before square leg runs in to gather it
overpitched outside off and put away. Drives it firmly back past the left of the bowler and the ball races away to the straight boundary. Got the timing perfect on that occasion
fuller ball, chips the flick in the air over midwicket for a brace

tries to clear the in field on the leg side, does not get the timing to perfection but he gets it well over the fielders there. The ball goes uppishly through deep midwicket but the outfield isn't quick because of the dampness and the ball stops a bit after it lands

ooh, nicely done. It was a length ball and Dickwella gets down on one knee early, seems like a pre-meditated move, but he has all the time in the world to play a scoop shot over his head and down to the fine leg boundary
full and moving away late, left alone
left alone in the channel outside off

fuller ball on the pads, can't keep bowling on the pads at that pace. Dickwella clips it and chips it in the air. Gets the timing spot on and the ball may have gone for six actually. They go upstairs to see if the ball has landed before the ropes or gone all the way. The third umpire has a long, hard look at it and it seems like it may have just carried all the way having landed right on the cushions
tries to tuck this fuller ball to the leg side but misses and is struck on the pad. They go up in appeal momentarily but stop it as the ball was heading down leg
clipped to square leg, man in the deep cuts it off
there's the scoop again. Gets down early again and has a lot of time to play a scoop shot to this length ball on the stumps and the ball goes to the fine leg boundary
short of a length outside off, runs it down to third man
back of a length ball, knocks it off the backfoot to mid-on

short of a length, holding its line outside off, punched off the backfoot through cover. Johnson Charles at cover-point moves across but is a bit slow to do so and his dive isn't enough to reach out for the ball which races away to the boundary
short ball outside off, gets out of the line of the ball

short of good length from around the stumps, Dickwella looks to open the face of his bat late and run it down to third man but the ball gets up way more than he expected and he can't get anywhere near it
a little bit of width on offer outside off again, this time the ball gets up just to his liking as Dickwella guides it to third man with an open bat face
short and wide, de Silva's eyes light up as he gleefully accepts it. Gets right on top of that and slaps it hard through the left of point

fuller ball on the fifth-stump channel, seems like de Silva was waiting for it. Drills it extremely hard back past the bowler. The bowler overcompensates after banging it in and de Silva was waiting for it
short ball outside off, swivels around to pull but the ball isn't short enough and does not get up as much. De Silva end sup chopping the pull shot to the ground
length ball, tucked off the pads to square leg for a single and that's the fifty of the partnership, off 39 balls
fuller and on the pads, clipped to square leg off the pads
comes down the track and Nurse drags his length back. But Dickwella is able to knock it to long-off
tries to open the face of his bat and run it down to third man  but gets cramped for room and is beaten
fuller ball, drilled back to the bowler
eased down to long-on
knocks it off the backfoot straight down the ground, long-on comes around it and gathers the ball
flat and full outside off, Dickwella comes down the track and pushes it to deep extra cover
stays in the crease to tackle this length ball and knocks it to long-on
stays in the crease and opens the face of his bat, but the ball does not turn as much and he picks out short third man
full and flat, driven back to the bowler
nudged to midwicket, no run there
flat length ball outside off, stays stuck in the crease and knocks it to the right of the bowler
comes down the track but does not quite get to the pitch of the ball as he lofts it over deep extra cover. There is a fielder in the deep and it goes on the bounce to him
fired in on middle and leg at around 90kph, uses the pace on the ball and gets down to sweep behind square
comes down the track and works it back to the bowler
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper cover
gets down to scoop, there is a fielder at deep fine leg who runs across to cut it off
fired from wide of the crease and flighted outside off, comes forward and eases it to sweeper cover
back of a length and slower through the air, punched off the backfoot to covers
short and wide, brings out the cut but hits it straight to cover-point
flighted outside off, gets across to meet the pitch of the ball before driving to mid-off
width on offer outside off, comes forward and knocks it to sweeper cover
comes down the track and eases it to long-off

dropped! Very tough chance, however. Dickwella tried to open the face of his bat but the ball does not spin enough, cramping him for room as a result. Gets an outside edge but with the wicketkeeper standing so close to the stumps, it was always going to be a tough chance
short and wide, cuts but does not middle it and chops it to cover-point
advances down the track and takes it on the full before pushing it back to the bowler
width on offer outside off, slaps it away to sweeper cover
comes down the track and takes it on the full before pushing ti to long-on
driven to sweeper cover
comes down the track but the bowler makes the adjustment and drags his length back, Dickwella fends it off to short cover
taps it to cover and calls for a quick single, there is a throw at the non-striker's end but Dickwella has made it
gets a long stride across to this length ball outside off and sweeps it to deep backward square leg, they have enough time to take two by the time the fielder can run across and cut it off
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
comes down the track and looks to nudge it to the leg side but wears it on the pad
tucked behind sqaure
comes forward and pushes this fuller ball back to the bowler
length ball, hangs back and opens the face of is bat to steer it to short third man
short and wide outside off, Dickwella lays into a cut shot and the ball races past the backward point region. There is a fielder at point and short third man but neither man can do anything about it
short and wide again, cut to cover-point
comes down the track and eases it down to long-on after fetching it from outside off
tucked to deep square leg
goes for the slog sweep but does not entirely get hold of it, gets it just wide of the fielder at deep midwicket who dives to his left to cut it off before the boundary
pitches it up on the stumps from around the wicket, de Silva eases it down to long-on
good length on off, not much turn away from the left-hander, keeps it out to the off side
gently nudges it to the leg side and the none-striker wants a single. But Dickwella denies him the run
comes down the track and pushes it in the air past the bowler down to long-on
flat length ball on leg stump, de Silva clips it to short midwicket
short and wide ball, chops the cut
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drives to short extra cover
flat and pitched up on off, comes forward and eases it past short extra cover and that's Dickwella's maiden ODI fifty
clipped to midwicket
stays in the crease to this length ball and tucks it to square leg
backed away early to this short and wide delivery and then tries to get closer to cut but can't beat backward point
fired flat on the pads, hangs back and whips through square leg
much slower through the air and outside off, Dickwella pre-meditates a lap-sweep, hits it fine of short fine leg. But it's a dot
Brathwaite held this one back in the air outside off, Dickwella is forced to check his drive, lobbed in the air wide of extra cover
dangled up down the leg side, de Silva goes low and sweeps it fine of short fine leg. Brings up his third ODI half-century with a boundary
shorter and flatter on the stumps, tucked to the right of midwicket
shorter and outside off, this time to the left hander, cut to sweeper on the back foot
tossed on middle from around the wicket, played back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, no turn, swept along the ground to deep midwicket
uppish drive, bounces in front of Gabriel at mid-off, and sneaks through him. Bad, bad bounce. Hangs it in the air outside off, de Silva is drawn into a big drive. Crashes it in the air and gets away
fuller on middle and leg, clipped away to mid-on
looped up, driven down the ground for one
another non-turning ball, skids on with the arm, nudged behind square
punched down to long-off
short and outside off, goes back and cuts to extra cover
flighted on middle and leg, played back to the bowler
dragged short on leg, de Silva has ample time to rock back and pull to deep midwicket
full and goes straight on outside off, down the pitch, and driven easily to long-off

Soft, soft dismissal. One-handed return catch, Kraigg Brathwaite provides WI with the breakthrough. Pushed through on middle and leg from around the wicket. No turn. De Silva aims a back-foot punch, but the ball stops on him. He checks his shot and simply lobs it in the air to the right of the bowler. Kraigg stretches his right hand and plucks it out. Maiden ODI wicket for him. De Silva inspects the toe end of the bat as he exits
tosses a low full-toss outside off, angled down fine of short third man
pushed full outside off, slices a drive to point
turn and bounce for Benn. Slower through the air, grips in the surface, and jumps past the outside edge
length and outside off, dabbed to point
tossed up and outside off, no turn, Mendis plants his front foot, meets the pitch, and drives solidly through the covers
fuller on middle, Dickwella attempts a dinky reverse-sweep, the ball goes only as far as point
dropped short on middle, no turn, skips back and pulls it away to deep midwicket
lobbed up wide outside off, just inside the tramline, left alone
skiddy flat one on off, chopped out to point
down the track, takes it from off and whips it away to midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped on the back foot to deep midwicket
attempted short ball outside off, stops on Dickwella. He hangs back and plays a checked punch straight to extra cover
drifts in full and outside off, front-foot drive to the left of the diving extra cover
flighted on off, turned with the wrists to midwicket
pushed through on the stumps, down the track and hit back to Benn
slider from Benn, skids on outside off, Dickwella slashes and misses. Think it did not bounce as much as the batsman expected
reverse-swept from the stumps to cover-point
here comes Dickwella, down the track. Benn pulls his length back on middle and leg. Still whipped away firmly to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, camps back and cuts it away to deep point
leg-side wide, left alone
slower through the air, shimmies out and quietly dead-bats it
dropped fractionally short and on off, Mendis manufactured room. Rocking back and outside leg to crash a cut through extra cover
tossed on middle and leg, goes low and sweeps it away to deep square leg
uses his feet, twirls his wrists and steals a single to the left of short midwicket
slides short on middle, skips back and forces a pull down to long-on
slower and full on off stump, blocked to the covers on the front foot
even fuller and outside off, driven on the front foot to the left of extra cover
good length on off, nudged with soft hands through square leg
shorter and outside off, Benn allows the batsman to go back and punch crisply to sweeper cover
runs down the pitch and secures a single to long-on
shorter on off, goes back and punches to the right of extra cover, long-off tidies up in the deep
darts it short on off, goes back and outside leg as he punches through cover-point
arrowed through outside off, short, Mendis nimbly moves back and nails a square-cut. Sri Lanka skipping away happily
skids on off, stays back and slices it off the outside half to the man at point
straight roller on middle and leg, front-foot drive down to long-on
uses his feet, does not get close enough to the pitch, and ends up deflecting a single square on the leg side
short on leg or just outside leg, swatted away to deep backward square leg, moving to his right
drops short and outside off, gets away. Chopped away to point
looped up just outside off, presses forward and drives smoothly down to long-off
skids on middle, hangs back and punches a single down to long-on.
Benn held it back in the air outside off, Mendis races down the track and looks to drive it inside-out. Ends up chipping in the air, lands in front of deep cover
fired in short, tucked around the corner for a single
good length and slid in with the arm, Mendis replies with a straight bat. Played into the covers
tossed on middle and leg, goes low, sweeping it square of Benn at short fine leg
Dickwella takes another trip down the pitch, opens the face and dabs a single in front of the covers. Excellent running from Dickwella and Mendis
flatter on off, backs away and cuts it away to point's right
Dickwella nips down the track and drives this tossed-up ball to long-on
pushed through down the leg side, Mendis goes low and unfurls another firm sweep. Placed fine of Nurse at long leg
shorter on the pads, hangs back and whips to deep midwicket. Kraigg Brathwaite finishes an uninterrupted spell: 10-0-56-1
short on off, stays back and whips to midwicket
full and flighted on off, flicked down to long-on. They take on the fielder, and scamper across for the second. Benn isn't amused
flatter and shorter on off, Dickwella aims to work to leg, plays early, and ends up getting a leading edge to the bowler's right
pushed through outside off, keeps a bit low, Mendis takes his eyes off the ball. Fails to connect with an expansive slog-sweep
Mendis now succeeds in slog-sweeping from outside off to deep square leg. Kept his eyes on the ball and belted it
back of a length on off, 141ks, no apparent discomfort, poked to point off the outside half
good length on off, takes it on the up and drives it gloriously straight ot mid-off. Leans forward and crunches it
back of a length and outside off, 143ks, opens the face and glides it to third man
indipper, slices Dickwella into half. Good length and outside off, sneaks through the bat-pad gap
good length and angling away from around the wicket, clipped down to mid-on
full on middle, stops on the batsman, who plays a checked drive to mid-on
flighted and outside off, carves a drive towards point
short and hurled outside off, chopped down to short third man
down the track, takes a full delivery, and works through square leg
slider on off, punched to point on the back foot
darted outside off, stretches out and powers a sweep to the square leg fence. The man in the deep is behind square
skids on outside off, stabbed back to Benn
full and outside off, hit back to the bowler
full and angling away outside off, manipulated with the wrists to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, punched to extra cover's left, who deflects it to mid-off's right
back of a length on off, punched down to mid-off
bouncer just outside off, ducks under it
very full on the pads, flicked down to fine leg
fuller and outside off, driven into extra cover with an open face
shorter and outside off, takes it on the up and lashes it to extra cover
flighted on the middle stump, drops to one knee and sweeps it in the air over cow corner. No protection in the deep there
good length and angled in, dabbed towards point off the face
skids on outside off, hint of extra bounce.  Mendis dares to go against the spin again. This time misses the sweep
full on the stumps, pushed down to long-on with a straight bat
back of a length and angling down leg, helped away fine of fine leg. Minimalist touch. Mendis becomes the third SL batsman to reach a fifty in this innings, and he's the quickest to the mark
leg-stump half-volley, flicked away through backward square leg
short on the leg stump, swivels on the back foot, rolls his wrists, and controls a pull down to long leg
back of a length and outside off, slashed away to the covers
short on middle, drop-and-run single to cover. Brings up SL's 200
back of a length on off, front-foot force back to the bowler, who stops it with his left hand
tossed on middle, attempts a reverse-sweep and it goes only as far as point
down the track, takes it from outside off, meets the pitch and caresses it over extra cover. Backed away too and drove inside-out
worked to midwicket
turned away to square leg for one
good length on off, quicker one, nudged to square leg
speared down leg, past the sweep, wide
speared short on middle, hangs back and punches it to Benn
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover
short ball, pulled away to backward square leg
short and wide, looks to slap it away and goes hard at it, gets it off the splice just wide of third man
fuller and slower on the stumps, closes the face of his bat and clips it to midwicket
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg, there is a fielder at backward square leg, but despite the lack of pace on that delivery, he manages to comfortably beat him
short ball and Dickwella tries to pull again, wears it on the helmet instead and the ball goes down to fine leg
tries to heave one and ends up working it down to long-on
gets down early to reverse sweep, does not get too much bat on it and the ball is pulled back by the fielder at shor third man
fuller ball on the stumps, clipped off the toes to the leg side

goes for a slog sweep and makes brilliant contact. It was wide outside off and he has to fetch it from there, but the timing is perfect and Mendis was right inside the line of the ball and heaves it comfortably and cleanly over the fence just behind deep square leg
short and wide, cuts but picks out point
full toss outside off, driven past the diving short extra cover fielder to long-off
short ball, swivels around and pulls it away to fine leg

looks to flick with the angle and gets rapped on the pads. Given out by umpire Illingworth. It was full and angling in after being fired from wide of the crease. Dickwella gets across but a long way and tries to flick it to the leg side. But he falls over slightly due to the extra yard he moves across and ends up leaving a big gap between bat and pad as the ball hits him in front of middle. Dickwella chooses to review it, but replays confirm that the angle would have taken the ball straight into middle and leg. And Dickwella will have to wait for another day for his first ODI century
good length outside off, stays in the crease and blocks
short ball, doesn't bounce enough to disconcert the batsman who swivels around with the pull to deep backward square leg
bouncer outside off, Mendis ducks under it
much better-directed short ball, a lot closer to the stumps this time and Mendis momentarily thinks of going for a hook, before deciding against it later and letting the ball go through to the keeper
width on offer outside off, does not spin back in much and Jayasuriya backs away and cuts to covers
closes the face of his bat early and gets a leading edge to cover
fuller ball outside off, driven straight to cover
fuller and on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
gives it too much air outside off and Mendis drives the full toss past the diving point fielder. Sweeper cover runs across to his left and cuts it off in the deep
slog sweep. Fetches it form outside off and whacks the full toss over deep midwicket for a clean six

very full ball on the leg stump channel, Jayasuriya tries to jam his bat down but is beaten by pace and gets rapped on the pad. Stifled appeal for lbw, but that was clearly heading down leg, would have missed by a big margin
fuller ball, turns it away to midwicket
full toss on the stumps, turns it away to deep midwicket
looks to open the face of his bat and steer through point but it is far too close to the off stump and he does not have enough room, gets beaten

short ball, pushed across, tries to pull but does not get the desired timing. He also had to fetch the pull from outside off, the ball also bounces more than he anticipates and he gets a mild top edge as the ball goes to midwicket
fuller outside off, drills it to cover and takes a single to keep the strike

full and on the pads, clipped towards mid-on and there is nobody there, so the bowler has to chase it down. They take him on and scamper back for the second. There is a throw from Nurse at the non-striker's end and the fielder collects it cleanly and takes the bails off. But he has made it back. Holder was the fielder, caught the ball in front of the stumps, could that perhaps have given the batsman just that split second extra?
stays back to this length ball, keeps low, drops it into the off side and they come across for a single
full toss, as juicy as it gets, fires it around waist length and Mendis gleefully accepts it and flays it over deep midwicket
gets down to paddle sweep this length ball but skews it off the splice to square leg
flat and short of a length outside off, some width on offer, cut to sweeper cover
width outside off, cut away between extra cover and long-off

bowled off the inside edge. It was a very full ball outside off, a near-yorker on the fourth or fifth stump channel, Jayasuriya tries to jam his bat down and squeeze it out into the off side but ends up dragging it back on to the stumps
goes for the wide yorker again but loses control over it and fires it too wide outside off, just outside the crease
fuller and a set of stumps outside off, Tharanga steers it to backward point after leaning forward
slow fuller ball outside off, eases into a drive that goes to mid-off
knocked to long-on for a single

loses control over the delivery and fires a near-beamer outside off. Fortunately for Brathwaite, the ball dips late and comes at just about waist-height for the batsman who steers it to the third man fence
sliding on with the arm on leg and middle. It is on a length and there is absolutely no turn. Mendis gets down on one knee and slogs it powerfully over deep midwicket
fires another fuller ball, this time pushes it further across on off stump channel, and Mendis flays it straight down the ground this time as the ball sails over the long-on boundary

Mendis pays the price for playing away from the body, pushed through quicker, on a length, outside off. There is a lot of width on offer and Mendis tries to use the pace and run it down to third man by opening he face of his bat. He had to reach out for it and gets an outside edge that is snaffled by the wicketkeeper. Mendis is livid with himself and another Sri Lanka batsman misses out on a century. Would have been a wide had he left it
knocks it to long-on
full and wide, leans forward and drives to sweeper cover
pitched up outside off, presses forward and eases it to sweeper cover
full and on the stumps, shuffles across and flicks it away to the leg side
tries to open the face of his bat and steer it to third man but makes no contact after getting cramped for room
slower full ball outside off, just pens the face of his bat to guide it to short third man
goes for the yorker and ends up bowling a low full toss on the stumps, Tharanga just slightly opens the face of his bat as he squeezes it out to the off side and the ball goes to point
slower ball outside off, does not pick the lack of pace and skews it to point after the ball stops on him
shuffles across and tucks it away to deep midwicket
full and outside off, makes room for himself by getting the front foot out of the way and haves i clean over the extra cover fielder as the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary
backs away and slaps this short of a length ball to sweeper cover
looks to heave one over midwicket but picks out the fielder there. It was on a length and in the slot outside off but Gunaratne doesn't manage to get any kind of timing on that one
short outside off, hops back and fends it off to the left of square leg
very full and angling in, clipped off the toes to midwicket
short of a length, swivels around and pulls it straight to deep backward square leg
back of a length and on the stumps, pulled away to deep square leg
rolls his fingers over the seam and bowls a fuller ball outside off at 117 kph, Tharanga whips it away to midwicket
yorker on the stumps, pacy this time, 134 kph, dug out wide of mid-on and they come back quickly for the second
short and wide, Pathirana backs away slightly and slaps it past deep backward point. And that is the 300 for Sri Lanka. West Indies have never chased down 300 against any team
short of good length again but there is absolutely no pace and all the width Pathirana could ask for, flays it through extra cover with a horizontal bat

put down by Johnson Charles at square leg. Holder does the wise thing and takes the pace off this back of a length ball. Tharanga executes the pull but the lack of pace means the ball stops on him a bit and he skews it off the top edge towards square leg where a fairly straightforward catch is put down
short and at a comfortable height for Tharanga who pulls but straight to deep midwicket

does not get hold of the pull shot. West Indies persisting with the short ball with lack of pace and trying to get the batsmen to hole out to the deep. Pathirana gets it just wide of the fielder at deep midwicket on the bounce

short and wide, slaps it square of the wicket to the vacant point region. Sweeper cover comes running in and the batsmen take him on for the second run. But Rovman Powell, the fielder just over-runs the ball and fails to gather it allowing an easy second run to be completed
full and wide, knocks it to sweeper cover
very full and angling in, clips it with the inward angle and gets it very fine, well inside the line of where fine leg is, inside the circle
takes the pace off and offers width outside off, Pathirana opens the face of his abt and steers it but straight to short third man
tries to heave it down the ground but again the lack of pace makes it difficult for the batsman to get any kind of solid power on the shot and skews it on the bounce to long-on
fires it full and down the leg side, Pathirana walks down the pitch and moves across, forcing Brathwaite to make the adjustment. Tries to tuck it fine off the pads but makes no contact
slower ball, shifts across and hops back before fending it off into the off side
full and on the pads, forcefully whipped down to long-on
ends the over poorly with a full toss, Tharanga pounces on it and lashes it through extra cover
very full ball an wide outside off, Pathirana lets it go and hopes it will be called a wide, but the umpire is happy with it
very full and very wide, Pathirana has to reach out for it and makes no contact as he tries to squeeze it out into the off side
short of a length, gets up on the batsman, who does well to just nudge it around to backward square leg
very full and on the toes, tries to clip it away but makes no contact as the ball goes to the off side off the pads
full toss outside off, tries to clear the off side in-field and flays it on the bounce to sweeper cover
short ball, no pace again, just 116kph and Tharanga gets a top-edge on the pull as the ball stops on him. He lobs it to square leg where Ashley Nurse runs back a few steps before snaffling it

inn2.comm: Charles, who is wearing sunglasses under the helmet, is pinned on the crease. Kulasekara hits a good length, angled into the pads from over the wicket. The ball rolls off the pad to square leg
good length and angling away outside off, played back down the pitch
full, starts outside leg, and swings down further, beating the keeper's full-stretch dive to his right. He had no chance. With fine leg inside the circle, it was a poor ball

big shout for lbw, umpire Matibiri shakes his head. May have pitched outside leg. Height is also an issue. But SL chance a review. Kulasekara's front foot is fine. Back of a length, angling away, from over the wicket, to hit the back pad above the knee-roll in front of off. The tracker confirms it pitched just outside leg. The on-field not-out call stands
good length and angling away, glided to point
overpitched on middle and leg, flicks it in the air to the left of mid-on, races away to the fence
full and sliding into the leg stump, eased away through square leg
half-volley on middle, drilled ram-rod straight past the bowler

back of a length on middle, Lewis shuffles across off, plays across the line, and is pinged on the back leg as he falls over. Hit well above the knee-roll. It may have pitched outside leg too. Umpire Illingworth shoots down the appeal
straying into the pads, glanced to long leg
full awayswinger, starts outside off and moves away further, left alone
good-length awayswinger, pitches just outside off and curls away. Ignored again
three awayswingers in a row, no shot offered outside off again
good length and slanting away outside off, Ervine is stapled to the crease as he throws his hands outside off and makes no contact
shorter and outside off, jabbed off the inside half to mid-on
back of a length, no lateral movement outside off, hits through the line. Punched away to extra cover
full and largely holds its line on a fifth-stump line, Charles shows restraint and lets it be
Kulasekara finally gets the inswinger right. Full, starts just outside off, and moves in. Inside-edged onto the pad

that's an impatient shot. Looks highly ungainly; having a blind swing with sunglasses on. Charles runs at Kulasekara, who had dragged his length back outside off. Has a roundhouse cross-batted swipe and only connects with thin air. Charles scoreless for eight balls
back of a length and angling away outside off, stops on the left-hander, chipped in front of extra cover
good length on middle, pushed back to Lakmal
skies a leading edge over extra cover. Full on middle and leg, looks to pick it up over midwicket. His head falls over as he spoons it over the off-side infield
length and outside off, hacked to mid-on
belted straight down the ground. Overpitched on off, shows the full face of the bat and punches it to Lakmal's right
good length and angling away outside off, Lewis eyes a slog over midwicket and ends up slicing an outside edge down to third man. Lewis isn't holding back
full on off, swung away wide of mid-on. Charles gets off the mark after nine balls
good length and angling away outside off, stays back and pushes to the left of extra cover, came off the toe end
back of a length and outside off, Lewis goes deep in the crease and punches it away between point and extra cover
half-volley outside off, crunched away to the left of short extra cover. It was in the air, the fielder dishes out a dive, but can't hang onto the chance
back of a length on off, swatted away to deep midwicket
full and curls away a bit, squares him up. Poked to the covers
full on off, gets forward and forces it to midwicket
half-volley outside off, and dispatched. Charles leans back, hits a drive through the line, between mid-off and extra-cover
good length, angled in on off, hangs back and blocks to mid-on
full and angled in, flicked on the front foot to deep midwicket

Dropped at backward point. by Kusal Mendis, I think. Juggles, juggles, the ball hits his head, and goes down. Short and width outside off, Lewis doesn't need second invitations for a cut. Scythes it in the air with all his might and gets away
back of a length and angling away, dabbed to point
back of a length and angled down leg, past the glance. Wide
low full-toss on off, chipped in the air over mid-on
Charles raises WI's 50 within seven overs. Slower full ball just outside off, Charles charges down the track, takes it on the half-volley and clobbers it into the bleachers at cow corner
slower cutter, played back to Kulasekara
near yorker on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on for a scampered single. Charles would have been home even if Mendis had effected a direct hit
full and outside off, driven through the line to the left of diving extra cover, Vandersay, subbing for Kusal, at mid-off dives to his right and lets it through him
too full on off, hit back to the bowler
short and outside off, scythed away to backward point
shortish, angled in, beats the pull, and strikes the waist
back of a length, outside off, cuts with no feet and chops an inside edge to short fine leg
half-volley on off, slower one at 119ks, Charles waits and pings a drive straight down the ground between mid-off and mid-on
short on the leg stump, Charles swivels and pulls in the air, up and over a leaping short fine leg

Holes out to mid-off. Tharanga collects the overhead catch. Slower cutter outside off, Charles waits and drills it hard. But doesn't keep it down. Sri Lanka find some breathing space after a bruising opening stand
dug in short and outside off, Charles' fall does not slow down Lewis. He rocks back and thumps a pull over Jayasuriya at deep square leg
the bowler overcorrects, half-volley outside off, Lewis takes it on the up and blasts a drive between Kulasekara and the non-striker
back of a length and angling away on a fourth-stump line, hangs back and plays it back to the bowler
full and stays low, Lewis misjudges the length. Camps back and wafts it down the pitch
good length and angled in, worked to midwicket
full and outside off, dabbed to short extra cover
another chance goes abegging. Pradeep runs to his right from mid-on, leaps and only finger-tips it away to the straight boundary. Slower delivery on off, lofted in the air
punched on the front foot to extra cover
neither too short nor too wide for a cut. Slashes and is beaten outside off
back of a length and angling away, jabs and toe-ends the ball into the covers
good length and angling away past the outside edge, bad bounce for the keeper. Bye
full on off, shuffles across and clips to midwicket
speared down leg, past the sweep
full and angled in on middle, pushed to extra cover
round-armed in on middle, played back with a straight bat
fired on middle, 90ks, chipped in front of Jayasuriya
looped up slower, nudged towards the cover-point region
full, straight roller on middle and leg, driven down the ground
full on the stumps, driven to long-off
back of a length and angling away outside off, punched to backward point
leg-stump ball, tucked to midwicket for his maiden ODI fifty
length and outside off, Brathwaite plays at the last moment, late-cutting to third man
short on off, stands tall and punches to extra cover
short on leg stump, misses the pull and takes it on the thigh
another leg-stump ball, tucked away to fine leg running across to his right for a double
non-turning offbreak on off, glanced fine of fine leg
pitched up just outside off, moves forward and drives to long-on
near yorker on off, dug out to extra cover's left
down the track, takes a full ball and drives down to long-off
slides on flatter outside off, hit to the right of the bowler, who stretches his right hand and grabs the ball
fired on off, keeps back and chops it square through the off side for one
too full and straight, flicked away to deep midwicket
good length and angling away on a fourth or fifth-stump line, played back to the bowler

Pradeep strikes in his second over, umpire Illingworth raises his finger. Lewis has a word with Brathwaite and challenges the on-field call. It would have hit the stumps but did it pitch in line? Good length and angling away from over the wicket, hits the knee-roll of the front pad. Lewis plays across his front pad and misses it completely.  No bat involved. The tracker shows it pitched marginally outside leg. WI's review is successful
back of a length on off, punched down the pitch
good length and he attempts a heave against the angle. Ends up skewing it over the covers
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches sweetly to sweeper cover
full and angled in, laced to sweeper cover
looped up outside off, turns, played back to the bowler
slides on off, worked to the right of short midwicket
too full on middle, driven down to long-off
slower through the air on off, moves across off and plays it back to the bowler
full on off, pushed away to the right of the bowler to mid-on
good length and outside off, square-driven through point for one
short and outside off, punched to the right of extra cover. The fielder throws himself to his right, but can't collect the ball cleanly, which means SL can't capitalise on a brief mix-up
full and angled in, happily flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, falls over and misses a pull. It would have crashed into the stumps, but it pitched outside leg. The batsman weathers the leg-before appeal
length and outside off, takes it on the up and hammers a drive between extra-cover and mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, falls over, but pull-flicks it down to fine leg
short and wide outside off, cut away disdainfully through the covers. Skipped back and muscled it
pitched up on off, finesse now. Opens the face and dabs through cover
full on middle and leg, nudged to leg
shorter outside off, goes deep in the crease, punching to extra cover
full and outside off, driven to the same fielder
down the track, takes it on the half-volley and forces it down to long-off
back of a length on off, punched down to mid-on
full and outside off, thrashes a drive on the up to the left of sweeper
back of a length and just a shade outside off, defended to cover
full and angling in, worked to midwicket, who throws himself to his right to intercept the ball
back of a length and angled in, punched to the left of the bowler
full and angled in, played up to mid-on off the inside half
full, straight roller on middle, driven down to long-on
angled in full and outside off from around the stumps, leans into the drive and hits to long-off
tossed up and spins back in, swept away to fine leg
full and outside off, driven down to long-off
full on the stumps, driven down to long-off, where Asela, I think, fumbles. Just a single
arm ball, skids in, inside-edged onto the thigh
back of a length and angling away outside off, punched down to third man
good length on off, run away off the face to point
full and angling down leg, wide
back of a length, angling into a whip to deep midwicket
short on off, stands up tall and plays a back-foot force to extra cover
fractionally short and outside off, Lewis swings his hands at a pull and bottom-edges it past the off stump to the right of the keeper. Streaks away to the fence
length and outside off, smeared in the air over extra cover
full and on the stumps, defended off the front foot down the pitch
shapes away to cut and picks out point
flat and on a length, presses forward and taps it to covers
pitches it further up on the stumps this time, Brathwaite quietly pushes it back o the bowler
very full around off, Brathwaite drives through extra cover before long-off runs across and cuts it off
flat and outside off, slashes to sweeper cover
full and outside off, drills it down to long-off

inside edge and bowled. That was one of those off-cutters that spun back in like an off-break. Brathwaite has no idea that the ball would jag back in that sharply and does not account for the turn. Leans across to meet the pitch of this fullish delivery and tries to drive but the ball spins in and takes the inside edge and takes the bails off. It momentarily looked like a caught behind as the wicketkeeper held the catch, but it took off the bails first
turning back in, blocked into the off side
fuller ball around off,
tucked to midwicket
flatter ball outside off, dabs it into the off side
hangs on to the backfoot and shuffles across before tucking this length ball off the pads to deep midwicket
width on offer outside off, cuts it neatly to sweeper cover

leading edge that just goes over covers. It was pushed across and Lewis advanced down the track as he looked to go over mid-on, but gets a leading edge and the ball carries just over extra cover and lands safely
clipped behind square
fuller and wide outside off, uses his wrists and flat-bats it to mid-on
fired full and outside off from wide of the crease, Hope leans forward and crunches it to sweeper cover
stays on the backfoot and drills it down to long-on from outside off

drags his length back slightly and Hope tries to go for a muscular pull but does not get the timing right as it came on to him too quickly. Ends up flat-batting it tstraight down the ground where long-off makes a good save
knocks it towards mid-on, the fielder at midwicket runs across and dives to make the save
good length outside off, blocked off the front foot to covers
shuffles across to protect his off stump and knocks it back to the bowler
fires it wide outside off and Lewis works it square of the wicket through the off side
makes room for himself before pushing it down to long-off
defended off the backfoot to the bowler
tries to work it through covers off the backfoot but the fielder at cover makes the stop
short and wide outside off, rocks back and nails the cut shot to sweeper cover
defended off the backfoot to the right of the bowler
very full ball, almost a yorker on leg stump, Hope jams his bat down and squeezes it out into the off side
very full ball, again yorks him and this time attacks the stumps as well, Hope drills it straight back to the bowler
length ball, tucks it off the backfoot after shuffling back but picks out square leg
stays back to this fullish ball and eases it down to long-on
full and on leg stump, clipped off the toes to midwicket where a slight misfield allows the run to be taken
pushed across to the left-hander at a fullish length from around the wicket, Lewis shuffles across and blocks into the off side
drills it straight down the ground to and the bowler gets a hand to it but does not stop it entirely

crunched through extra cover. Loopy delivery that slides in with the arm on middle and off and Hope leans forward and plays a lovely cover drive, gets it wide enough of the diving fielder at extra cover. Struck very hard
pushed through the off side
angling across from outside leg stump, Lewis gets down and sweeps powerfully to fine leg
floated up on the stumps, defended
gets down to paddle sweep it early but it's a length ball and hence gets up on him more than he would have liked. Manages to fend it off towards fine leg down on one knee, nonetheless
stays on the backfoot and knocks it to mid-wicket
fuller outside off and spinning back in slightly, knocks it to midwicket from the crease
turns it away to midwicket
defends this fuller ball after bending forward and gets it slightly off the outside part of the bat to the off side
length ball, offers some width outside off, Lewis looks to back away and shapes up for a cut but he can't beat cover
good length, holding its line on the fourth-stump channel, Hope stands tall and punches to mid-off

sees some width on offer and goes for the cut shot but there is not enough room and there is some good pace on that delivery. The ball jags back in slightly as well, cramping Hope for room and leaving him beaten
drops it in front of point and looks for a quick single but the batsmen decide against it

driven on the up just to the left of extra cover. It was full and right in the slot for Hope, holding its line as well, so he comes forward and lays into the drive. The fielder at mid-off can only helplessly look on
shuffles across the stumps before nudging it to midwicket

knocks it straight to mid-on and sets off for a very quick single straightaway. The fielder at mid-on gathers in cleanly but refrains from having a shy at the non-striker's end as the batsmen have completed the run in a jiffy
whipped off the backfoot with a flat bat to long-on
length ball, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
hangs back and punches it straight down the pitch where the bowler makes a lazy attempt to stop the ball and lets it get away

shuffles across to cover his stumps before nudging this fuller ball on leg stump to the leg side, between deep midwicket and long-on. Lewis calls for the seocnd and Pradeep in the deep runs across and gathers the ball before firing a direct hit at the non-striker's end where Hope is out by a huge distance, as replays show
stays on the backfoot and punches it straight back to the bowler who gets his fingertips to the ball before it hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. But Carter is inside the crease
sprays it down the leg side and Lewis can't make contact on the glance
short of a length ball, Lewis rocks on to the backfoot before whipping it down to long-off and that is the maiden ODI century for Lewis

massive appeal for lbw, not given by the umpire. Lewis was looking to shuffle across and clip this ball to the leg side. But he misses and is struck on the pad as the ball rolls away to the leg side and they cross over for the single. But it pitched outside leg
width on offer outside off, runs it down to third man
short ball, looks to pull but the ball seems to be heading down leg but it is not called a wide. Maybe the umpire felt it went over the leg stump
length ball on leg, shuffles across before tucking it behind square
short ball, banged in on the stumps, pulled to deep midwicket and he rolls his wrists over it to keep it down
gets an outside edge as he closes the face of his bat to try and flick this length ball, the ball runs away to third man
length ball, pushed across, drills it off the backfoot to long-off
fuller ball outside off, waits for it in the crease before guiding it to cover-point
hangs back to this fuller ball, it keeps a tad low outside off, but Lewis whips it with a corss bat to long-on

gets down to slog sweep and gets it on the bounce over the deep midwicket fence. In fact, there is a chance for the deep midwicket fielder to catch but he misjudges it. It was full and on the leg stump channel. Pradeep does not get around it in time before helplessly throwing one hand towards the ball. But it's too late and the ball escapes past him into the fence
goes down looking for another slog sweep but misses it this time as the ball spins past Lewis
slightly quicker this time, Lewis runs it down to long-off with a flat bat. Not the most convincing shot

starts off with a wide. It is short and angling across and rises steeply. Seems like a close call. It was pushed across but seemed within the line. The bounce seemed alright as well but called a wide. So one that was definitely a wide was not given earlier and now this

short ball, shuffles across and pulls it. Gets it off the top edge but the fine leg boundary is a short one and the ball carries all the way. Poor start from Pradeep. Just one ball bowled and seven off it already

oh, gone! That seemed to come out of the blue. Nobody thought for a second that that was gone. Even Sri Lanka are a little surprised here. It was a short of a length ball that was whipped towards mid-on with a cross bat by Lewis. Carter wanted a run, but Lewis sin't interested and sends him back. But the fielder, who is slightly deep, comes in in a jiffy, swoops down and fires a direct throw. Carter is casual in getting back to the crease and is gone by a surprisingly big distance
shuffles across to this fuller ball before pushing it straight down the ground towards mid-off
short of a length ball that nips in from outside off, Powell tries to slap it to the off side but gets it off the bottom part of the bat to point
tries to run one down to third man and gets it off the outside edge as a result of which the ball goes very fine and to the boundary
back of a length and angling in, tucked off the backfoot with the angle to square leg

is that another run out? Powell closes the face of his bat and gets a leading edge to covers and takes off for a very sharp single. It's another direct hit at the striker's end. They go upstairs to check and Powell is out by some margin. However, more replays are sought as it seems like the wicketkeeper may have inadvertently brushed the stumps as he was collecting the ball. Indeed, he has and West Indies avoid another disaster
short and wide, slapped away from the crease past the diving extra cover fielder. A near run out and now a boundary. It's all happening here

knocks it to mid-on. The fielder there has a casual shy at the non-striker's end, quite needless with the batsman inside the crease. The ball deflects off th stumps and there is no good back-up and they take the overthrow
shuffles across and pulls this short of a length ball past deep backward square leg

very full ball on the stumps, drilled very hard down the ground, seems like he was expecting it. Long-off runs across and makes a superb stop as he cuts it off clean before the boundary. That was struck extremely hard and was racing away. It is cut off just before the boundary and they go upstairs to check if the foot brushed the boundary, but he seems to have done fine there
shuffles across in the crease and gets it off the inside part of the bat to backward square leg
short of a length outside off, keeps a tad low, but manages to keep it out to point
fuller and on the stumps, knocked back to the bowler
length ball that comes back in, defended to the off side
nudges it to the on side
down the leg side. Powell misses the attempted glance and it seems like he wore it on the pad. Wide not given, so it definitely hit the pads. Appeal for lbw but it would have missed leg
fuller ball, drilled hard between long-on and deep midwicket and they come back for a quick second
fuller on the stumps, leaves a gap between bat and pad but manages to put bat to ball and drop it in front of cover for a quick single
full and outside off, smacked hard to long-off
full toss on the stumps, gently pushes it back to the bowler

yorker angling down leg and it's given. It seems like it was heading down leg but umpire Illingworth thinks it is hitting. It was full and dips in late on the batsman as he tries to clip it away to the leg side. Gets hit on the back boot and Powell goes for the review straightaway. There was no bat involved there. Replays show that the ball would have hit the leg stump flush, so good decision
fuller ball on the stumps, driven neatly to mid-off. The ball deflects to mid-on after hitting something around that area just as the fielder was swooping down to field it
comes forward to defend and gets an inside edge to the pad
pitched up on middle and leg, driven to long-off
good length on the stumps, punches off the backfoot to long-off
flat back of a length ball, tucked away to midwicket
flatter ball again but slightly fuller this time, tucks it to the leg side but still can't beat midwicket
powerfully struck. That was wide outside off and Holder punches it uppishly through extra cover where the fielder puts in a dive but to no avail as the ball shoots past him
full toss outside off, opens the face of his bat as he drives and skews it to backward point
yorker on leg stump, dug out to long-on
fuller ball on the fifth-stump channel, driven to sweeper cover
yorker on the stumps, Lewis looks to clip it off the toes to the leg side but ends up chopping it on to the pads. No run there
superb bowling. Very full and on the stumps, Lewis looks to clip it away and gets it off the inside part of the bat to short fine leg
full toss on the stumps, it does not come at a very comfortable height for Holder who can only push it back to the bowler

slogged away and what a shot. That was in the slot was Lewis. It was pushed across from around the wicket and full on the stumps. Lewis gets the front foot across and nails the slog as the ball soars over deep midwicket
ooh, goes for the slog again but this one is on a length rather than fuller and he makes no contact
thinks of the slog again but decides against it late upon seeing the line and trajectory and drives it instead through covers
short of a length ball, punched off the backfoot to long-off

taps it in front of covers and takes off for the run. Lewis obliges but could have been in trouble as mid-off runs in and collects it and fires a good throw to the wicketkeeper. Not a direct it though which could have had him in trouble

slog sweep across the line and he nails it again. It was full and Lewis gets the front leg out of the way before heaving it over deep midwicket. And he goes down after the shot. He is being attended to. If Lewis is unable to continue here, it may be trouble for West Indies. He has to be the man who sees West Indies through from this point
short of a length outside off and some width on offer, Holder slashes and fend it off to backward point
fuller ball outside off, Holder presses forward and drives it between sweeper cover and long-off. It's a vacant region and he calls for two and they comfortably beat the throw from the deep
slower ball, Holder drops it into the off side and calls for a quick single. Lewis, though struggling, manages to make it before anybody can come around the ball and have a shy at the stumps
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches it through covers
very full ball on leg stump, Holder knocks it quietly back to the bowler

short of a length and it is a slower ball. It's the legcutter from Pradeep and you can't be bowling it at that length at that pace. Holder had all of eternity to pick the length and pulls it over deep midwicket. Clears the biggest part of the ground by a big distance
good length on middle, opens the face, and glides it down to short third man. Kulasekara collects the ball, but there is no backing-up at the other end. Lewis takes two
slower cutter on the leg stump, slog-sweeps early and misses

Holder is simply ball-watching, horrible mix-up, and it results in the third run-out of the innings. Nonetheless, Lewis elicits a standing ovation for his maiden ODI hundred. Full roller on off, jabbing drive to the left of mid-off. Mendis moves swiftly to his left and releases the ball to the keeper. Lewis, who is suffering from cramps, ventures halfway down the pitch. Holder, though, having turned his back to Lewis, is only watching the ball. Lewis if forced to undo his steps. Lewis, ultimately, gave up, caught miles short. Dickwella does the rest
full and outside off, driven straight down the ground
full roller outside off, glided towards point
drop-and-run single to the covers. No confusion here
full and outside off, Holder is rooted to the crease as he chases a wild drive and misses
low full-toss on the stumps, hit back to the bowler's right
full and angled down leg, smart diving save from Dickwella, throwing himself to his left
Lakmal errs in line again, darted down leg
middle-stump full-toss, driven down to long-off
finally nails the yorker, bang on off stump, squeezed out to mid-on
length delivery on off, hits a drive, through the line, and secures a single to long-off
attempts the yorker, ends up serving up a full-toss, which is whipped away to deep midwicket

Two fielders - Tharanga and Pathirana - converge and make a mess of that skier. Carlos has been dropped. Looks like another cutter. Carlos looks to force the pace and goes searching for a loft. Ends up skewing it in the air. Tharanga moves back and to his left from mid-on, Pathirana moves to his right from mid-off. Tharanga goes for the catch, calls for it, attempts with both hands. The ball bursts out. Tharanga never seemed in control of it
full and outside off, creamed down to long-off
length and outside off, glided to point
full and outside off, front-foot drive to long-off
shortish offcutter, knocked down the ground
full on middle, driven down the ground, through the legs of Holder
full on off, whipped away to wide long-on
Whoa. Carlos has launched it over the sightscreen at the Queens. Where's the ball? Lost. Slower delivery on the off stump, Carlos picked this up and dispatched it over long-on. 101-metre strike
full and drifts a slower delivery down the leg side
near yorker on middle and leg, clipped to wide long-on for two
off-stump yorker, dug out back to the bowler
off-stump yorker, whipped to wide long-on running in, just a single
full on middle and leg, driven down the ground, to long-on. 12 off that over
too full on middle and leg, not quite a yorker, whipped down to long-on. They scamper across for two
good length on middle, confidently driven to long-on
full and slanting down leg, past the glance. 14th wide of the innings
pitched up and outside off, pushed to extra-cover, straight to the fielder
leg-stump full toss, flicked away to deep midwicket
very full on the stumps, played back to the bowler
full-toss on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
full and angled in on leg, driven down to wide long-on. WI settle with a single as the fielder swoops down on the ball
full on middle and leg, whipped away with a flourish to cow corner
full around off, Holder's open-faced drive finds point
pitched up on off, Holder winds up and drills a drive to extra cover
Holder backs away outside leg, Kulasekara chases him with a full ball. Clipped to long-on, running in. They hare across for the second. The long reach works, and easily done in the end
full-toss on the leg stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
full on the legs, two in the call, whipped away between deep midwicket and deep square leg. WI go past 300
full on the legs again, very full. Whipped away between deep midwicket and deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, clipped away square on the leg side
low full-toss on middle, pushed down to long-off
leg-stump full-toss, twirled away to deep square leg
back of a length, offcutter on off, hangs back and glides it gently off the face to backward point and sets off
full-toss on the leg stump, flicked to deep square leg

big wicket for Kulasekara, the middle stump is tilted back. Carlos departs. The chase is getting tighter. Very full on middle, not an accurate yorker, swings in. Carlos winds up for a giant goftswing. Big backlift. The bat has to travel a long way from there.  He can't connect and Kulasekara hits the middle stump
full, angled in on leg stump, off the pad and rolls to midwicket, they scamper across for a bye
very full and outside off, driven to extra cover
Holder backs away outside leg, Kulaseka chases him with a very full ball. Excellent bowling. Driven only to mid-off

Holder races down the track, he has to deal with a full-toss. Hacks at it and an inside edge streaks away to fine leg. Impressive over under pressure from Kulasekara. Just five runs off that over. SL haven't conceded a boundary since the 44th over
Holder backs away outside leg, nails a yorker following the batsman, off the pad and squirts away to square leg

yorker shading just outside the leg stump, wild swing and a miss. Has Nurse inside-edged it onto the thigh pad, before the keeper collected it? Dickwella goes up for an appeal. The umpires Illingworth and Matibiri converge and the soft signal is out. Holder isn't amused. Lakmal's front foot is fine.  Nurse attempts a cross-batted slog, having dropped to one knee. Nicks it onto the back thigh, replays confirm it; I can spot the deflection. TV umpire Gough rules Nurse out after much deliberation. Clean catch from Dickwella behind the stumps. Terrific bowling from SL's seamers under pressure. Nurse drags himself off the field

full and angling away outside off from over the wicket, fortunate boundary for WI. Benn pushes with no feet, and nicks it through where first slip may have been. The edge streaks away to the boundary, the first since the 44th over
yorker on middle and leg, jammed out to midwicket, a misfield allows a single
too full on middle and leg, Holder, who is standing deep in the crease, whips it away to deep square leg. The race off for the second. The throw from the deep is towards Benn's end. He makes it
Holder shimmies down the pitch, the bowler strays a full ball down leg, following the batsman. Dickwella throws himself to his left to collect the ball
low full-toss on leg stump, hit down to long-on. Holder gets the strike
yorker bang on middle, what a ball. Holder aims a hack across the line, and inside-edges to short fine leg. He takes the single
Benn showed his ace early. Stepped out and Pradeep dragged his length back. Angling away outside off. Benn attempts a massive swipe and misses
Benn connects with a slog now and dumps Pradeep into the bleachers at deep midwicket. Back of a length and angling away outside off, clears his front leg and clubs it with all his might
very full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, 148.1ks, like the last ball Tiripano bowled to Holder in that tied match. Drives and only connects with thin air
Holes out to deep cover, running to his right. But they have crossed over. Near yorker, very, very full and outside off. Benn carves it in the air.Terrific take under pressure from de Silva

Pradeep nails a middle-stump yorker, 144ks. Top ball, again. Holder, having backed away outside leg, can only jam it out to extra cover. You can't do much against pinpoint yorkers. He manages only a single. Sri Lanka win by one run and qualify for the final
